title: EMEA Head of Risk Partnerships and Strategy
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Risk team is responsible for the health and success of Stripe’s financial platform,  managing our exposure credit, fraud, regulatory and the payments ecosystem. Within the Risk organization, the Partnerships Risk Strategy team leads the risk interface with our financial partners and works cross functionally with internal teams to build a best in class risk platform. Through collaboration with risk partners, we drive sustained value and growth for our users.
What you’ll do
As the EMEA (Europe, Middle East, & Africa) Head of Risk Partnerships & Strategy, you will lead a team responsible for working with our global and regional financial partners to mutually unlock new business opportunities and user verticals, innovate shared risk methodologies, and establish / ensure compliance to our agreed risk appetites. You will own the related  risk initiatives across Stripe products, systematically making step-change improvements in the breadth and depth of Stripe’s risk management capabilities. You will build strategic relationships with the executive level of our financial partners and represent Stripe as a thought leader in the industry.
Responsibilities

You will build and execute a long-term strategy
Make the business decisions and policies around risk approaches 
Represent and negotiate our risk approach to payment partners
Optimize existing operational levers and build new ones
Develop a long-term strategy on how we can cultivate mutually beneficial partnerships with our financial partners to rapidly expand Stripe’s Global Payments and Treasury Network (GPTN)
Drive the risk-related partnerships and product discussions with our most important financial partners to ensure that we have alignment on risk approaches and strategy
Unlock business opportunities by innovating on risk-aware solutions to expand our product and user base
Develop and manage the processes necessary to allow the organization to operate effectively, which will include partnering on engineering architecture and streamlined processes in support of sound risk management

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement. 
Minimum requirements

The ability to represent Stripe at the executive level with a wide range of external partners and government agencies
Deep, credible, and rewarding partnerships with financial institutions globally, with a focus on consumer and retail financial services
A demonstrated ability at balancing prudent risk management with commercial outcomes 
A clear contributor to building and managing the P&L and trajectory of an expansive business
Strong stakeholder management including navigating difficult situations, negotiating timelines, and influencing internal and external stakeholders across organizations and borders
Experience managing a rapidly growing global team in a high-growth company, and the ability to recruit, manage, and mentor high performing individuals
The drive to flourish with minimal guidance; proactive and thrive in uncertain and ambiguous environments
Minimum 12 years of experience

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
